messages.message: Hey everyone! In the local dev setup, is there a way to *kill  pending celery app tasks* so that it doesn’t flood the app-tasks? if we have to re run a step, the previous run is run until it’s task is done? I tried using *celery flower* as mentioned in the dev setup doc, however it fails to load the *tasks. Any alternative ways to kill the tasks?*

Hello, you can purge the rabbitmq by going here: http://localhost:15672/#/queues/%2F/celery
login: c0nsole, password: c0nsole
It doesn’t work for me! I tried looking it up here as well and tried multiple times but it fails

@pankaj.hazra Here is another way:

flush a celery queue that just won't die:
-- Ctrl-C Redis
-- Ctrl-C RabbitMQ
-- rm dump.rdb
-- Restart Redis
-- Restart RabbitMQ
-- Run: /usr/local/sbin/rabbitmqadmin list queues | cut -d '|' -f 2 | grep -v \+ | xargs -n1 -I@ /usr/local/sbin/rabbitmqadmin purge queue name=@
guest:guest worked.. he was running rabbitmq locally, without docker.
just seeing this @pankaj.hazra - the local rabbitmq run does not use this env file :slightly_smiling_face:  Thus it has the default rabbitmq password guest:guest.
this would be a great Q/A to codify into our internal https://stackoverflow.com/ — could you help with that @abhilash, thanks!

Here it is: https://stackoverflow.com/c/instabase/questions/41/42#42
I too learned the `celery purge` command with this :smile:
